channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: With Slow Spring Homebuying, Zillow Predicts Price Drops in 2025
item.description: Zillow’s latest housing market forecast shows a decline in home prices over the next year after a very slow spring homebuying season. While spring is traditionally the hottest time of […]

item.title: Spain’s exposure to climate change helps Madrid-based VC Seaya close €300M climate tech fund
item.description: According to a recent Dealroom report on the Spanish tech ecosystem, the combined enterprise value of Spanish startups surpassed €100 billion in 2023. In the latest confirmation of this upward trend, Madrid-based VC fund Seaya has closed Seaya Andromeda, an “Article 9” €300 million climate tech fund based out of Madrid. Article 9 refers to the EU’s Sustainable […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Crime Rates and the 2024 Election: What You Need to Know
item.description: As crime data again becomes a flashpoint in the presidential campaign, experts push for better national statistics.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: 9 Surprisingly Hot Markets Where Investors Can Still Find Affordable Short-Term Rental Properties
item.description: These under-the-radar markets still have plenty of affordable inventory and could be potential goldmines for short-term rental investors.

item.title: Forestay, Europe’s newest $220M growth-stage VC fund, will focus on AI
item.description: Forestay, an emerging VC based out of Geneva, Switzerland, has been busy. This week it closed its second fund, Forestay Capital II, at a hard cap of $220 million. The VC wasn’t well known in Europe until it started to lead rounds in enterprise startups a couple of years ago, notably scanning software startup Scandit […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Death Row Prisoner’s Parting Interview
item.description: Days before his scheduled execution in Texas, Ramiro Gonzales speaks on faith, legacy — and apologizing to the family of his victim, Bridget Townsend.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: Yes, Earning Financial Independence Has Downsides
item.description: Earning financial independence requires making sacrifices that not many talk about.

item.title: A year later, what Threads could learn from other social networks
item.description: Threads, Meta’s alternative to Twitter, just celebrated its first birthday. After launching on July 5 last year, the social network has reached 175 million monthly active users — that’s a notable achievement. But, after a year, Threads is trying to find its own voice by not being as newsy as Twitter/X and not being as […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The New Battle Over an Old Institution: Forced Prison Labor
item.description: Inside the latest legal and legislative efforts to close state constitutional loopholes that allow slavery as punishment for a crime.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: My 1031 Exchange Property Is Listed. Here’s How I’m Managing the Clock.
item.description: After six months, Liz's personal property is on the market and the 1031 exchange process is almost set.

item.title: J2 Ventures, focused on military healthcare, grabs $150M for its second fund
item.description: J2 Ventures, a firm led mostly by U.S. military veterans, announced on Thursday that it has raised a $150 million second fund. The Boston-based firm invests in startups whose products are purchased by civilians and the U.S. Department of Defense. While many emerging VCs are struggling to raise second funds, J2’s latest vehicle is more […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mississippi Wants to Allow Some Votes From Jails and Prisons. Red Tape May Stop It.
item.description: A new state law will allow more people in jails and prisons to cast absentee ballots, but many obstacles remain.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: Is Rent-to-Own the Easiest and Most “Passive” Way to Scale Your Portfolio?
item.description: Do you have a cash flow problem? Maybe property management fees are setting you back, or you’re spending too much on repairs and maintenance. Today, we’re bringing you a powerful […]

item.title: HealthEquity says data breach is an ‘isolated incident’
item.description: HealthEquity said in an 8-K filing with the SEC that it detected “anomalous behavior by a personal use device belonging to a business partner.” © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Minneapolis Cop Who Beat Him Pleaded Guilty. He Still Fears the Department Won’t Change.
item.description: Jaleel Stallings was swept up in the chaos of protests over George Floyd’s murder. The outcome changed his life.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
